title: file
lessonContent:
In the previous lesson we learned about touch, let’s go back to that for a bit. Did you notice that the filename didn’t conform to standard naming like you’ve probably seen with other operating systems like Windows? Normally you would expect a file called banana.jpeg and expect a JPEG picture file. In Linux, filenames aren’t required to represent the contents of the file. You can create a file called funny.gif that isn’t actually a GIF. To find out what kind of file a file is, you can use the file command. It will show you a description of the file’s contents. 
$ file banana.jpg
exercise: Run the file command on a few different directories and files and note the output.
quizQuestion: What command can you use to find the file type of a file?
